Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style or Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with pin wheel rosettes and blobs in added red and added white; exterior: slip almost completely worn, at left, traces of undetermined motif in black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Although Lemos places this sherd within the Chalice Style, the deterioration on the exterior surface and elaborate interior decoration suggest that the sherd could possibly also belong to the Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, pl. 152) (Number not precised (possibly no. 1103))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0865) (phase 2)
